children.title: Core Knowledge Language Arts, Listening and Learning
children.teaser: Students to acquire language competence through listening.

children.title: All About Me
children.teaser: Students actively listen to read-alouds and teachers encourage student contribution and participation.

children.title: I Am Special
children.teaser: Students describe themselves and their appearance

children.title: Describing Me
children.teaser: Students state two things that make them special

children.title: Shades of People
children.teaser: Students state the outside of their body is covered by skin

children.title: Body Parts
children.teaser: Students point to and name body parts

children.title: Inside Body Parts
children.teaser: Students describe two ways body parts help us move

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students state that all people are human beings

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students will describe themselves and their appearance

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students state that the heart and lungs are parts hidden in the body

children.title: My Five Senses
children.teaser: Students state the five senses

children.title: How I Use My Five Senses
children.teaser: Students state how each of the five senses help them experience the world

children.title: How I Use My Five Senses (cont.)
children.teaser: Students state the five senses

children.title: I Am Growing and Changing
children.teaser: Students state that human beings begin life as babies, grow to children then adults

children.title: I Am Growing and Changing (cont.)
children.teaser: Students name one thing babies can do

children.title: Three Basic Needs
children.teaser: Students state that all people are human beings

children.title: Three Basic Needs (cont.)
children.teaser: Students will name humans beings' three basic needs

children.title: My Amazing Body
children.teaser: Students will state how people stay healthy

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students state that the heart and lungs are parts hidden inside the body

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students state the five senses

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students will identify the parts of the body that correspond to each sense

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Assessment of All About Me

children.title: Families and Communities
children.teaser: This domain builds students' knowledge of families, houses and homes, and community roles.

children.title: All Kinds of Families
children.teaser: Students will name the members of their own families

children.title: Families and Communities
children.teaser: Students will name two ways that their family cares for them

children.title: Houses and Homes
children.teaser: Students will define a home as a shelter where a family cares for each other

children.title: Houses and Homes (cont.)
children.teaser: Students will name and describe two kinds of homes where families might live

children.title: Families Work and Play Together
children.teaser: Students will name two chores or routines that they do with their families

children.title: Family Activities and Chores
children.teaser: Students will name two activities they do with their families

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students will name the members of their own families

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students will state that their family is made up of people who care for them

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students will name and describe two kinds of homes where families might live

children.title: Full of Love
children.teaser: Students will name and describe one of their own family traditions

children.title: Full of Love (cont.)
children.teaser: Students will name at least one member of their extended family

children.title: Family Celebrations and Traditions
children.teaser: Students will name and describe one of their own family traditions

children.title: Holidays
children.teaser: Students will state two different ways their family celebrates

children.title: Show and Tell: Celebrations and Traditions
children.teaser: Students name and describe one of their own family traditions

children.title: Careers
children.teaser: Students state the name of the community where they live

children.title: Community Helpers
children.teaser: Students name and describe two different community helpers

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students name and describe two different community helpers

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students will name and describe one of their own family traditions

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students will name at least one member of their extended family

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Assessment of Families and Communities

children.title: Animals
children.teaser: This domain builds students' knowledge of various animals.

children.title: Humans are Animals
children.teaser: Students will identify at least ten animals by name

children.title: About Animals
children.teaser: Students will state that students are animals

children.title: Body Parts of Animals
children.teaser: Students will identify three body parts of animals that are not human

children.title: Animals Have Three Basic Needs
children.teaser: Students will state that animals have three basic needs

children.title: Animals Have Three Basic Needs (cont.)
children.teaser: Students will state three basic needs of animals

children.title: How Animals Protect Themselves
children.teaser: Students will describe at least two ways animals protect themselves from weather

children.title: How Animals Protect Themselves (cont.)
children.teaser: Students will describe at least two ways animals protect themselves from other animals

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students name various animal body parts

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students describe how animals use specific body parts

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students state that animals have three basic needs

children.title: Mothers and Baby Animals
children.teaser: Students pair pictures of mother and baby animals that look similar to each other

children.title: Mothers and Baby Animals (cont.)
children.teaser: Students pair pictures of mother and baby animals that look similar to each other

children.title: Baby Animals
children.teaser: Students give an example of two animals that are born alive/give birth to live babies

children.title: What Hatches From an Egg
children.teaser: Students will identify two ways that animals are born

children.title: From Caterpillar to Butterfly
children.teaser: Students will give examples of two animals that hatch from eggs/lay eggs

children.title: Groups of Animals: Birds, Fish, and Insects
children.teaser: Students will sort pictures of birds fish and insects

children.title: Groups of Animals: Mammals
children.teaser: Students will state one defining characteristics of mammals

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students will state two defining characteristics of birds

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students will state two defining characteristics of fish

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students will state one defining characteristics of insects

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Students will carry on a dialogue with a same-aged peer

children.title: Plants
children.teaser: This domain builds students' knowledge of various plants and plant types.

children.title: Plants Are All Around Us
children.teaser: Students will state that plants are alive

children.title: Plants Have Different Parts
children.teaser: Students will name the four parts of a plant

children.title: Plants Have Different Parts (Continued)
children.teaser: Students will state the function of the four parts of a plant

children.title: Sunflowers
children.teaser: Students will state that flowers grow from seeds

children.title: Sunflowers (Continued)
children.teaser: Students will name the four parts of a plant

children.title: Plants Grow
children.teaser: Students describe how a sunflower grows

children.title: Plants Grow (Continued)
children.teaser: Students state that trees are plants that grow for a long time

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students name five plants

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material (Continued...)
children.teaser: Students name the four parts of a plant

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material (Continued)
children.teaser: Students state the function of the four parts of a plant

children.title: Plants Have Basic Needs
children.teaser: Students name plants four basic needs

children.title: Flowers
children.teaser: Students name plants four basic needs

children.title: Flowers (Continued...)
children.teaser: Students will state that flowers make seeds and fruit so new plants can grow

children.title: Flowers (Continued)
children.teaser: Students will use the word petal to label the colorful parts of a flower

children.title: A Fruit Is A Suitcase for Seeds
children.teaser: Students will state that fruits have seeds that grow into new plants

children.title: Plants Are Important to Humans and Animals
children.teaser: Students will state three ways that plants are important to humans and animals

children.title: Tasting Fruits and Vegetables
children.teaser: Students will name five food that come from plants

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students will name five foods that come from plants

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material (Continued...)
children.teaser: Students will name plants four basic needs

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material (Continued)
children.teaser: Students will name plants four basic needs

children.title: Domain Assessment
children.teaser: Assessment of Plants

children.title: Habitats
children.teaser: This domain teaches about habitats, places where plants and animals live together.

children.title: The Woodland
children.teaser: Students will identify by name the woodlands

children.title: Animals in a Woodland
children.teaser: Students will identify by name the woodlands

children.title: In the Woods: Who's Been Here
children.teaser: Students will identify by name the woodlands

children.title: In the Woods: Who's Been Here (Continued)
children.teaser: Students will name one plant and two animals that live in the woodland

children.title: Life in a Pond
children.teaser: Students will identify by name the pond habitat

children.title: Who Lives in a Pond
children.teaser: Students will identify by name the pond habitat

children.title: Who Lives in a Pond (Continued)
children.teaser: Students will identify by name the pond habitat

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students will name one plant and two animals that live in the woodland

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material (Continued...)
children.teaser: Students will name one plant and two animals that live in the woodland

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material (Continued)
children.teaser: Students will identify by name the pond habitat

children.title: The Ocean
children.teaser: Students will identify by name the ocean habitat when shown a picture of the ocean

children.title: The Ocean (Continued)
children.teaser: Students will name three animals that live in the ocean

children.title: The Desert
children.teaser: Students will identify by name the desert habitat

children.title: The Desert (Continued)
children.teaser: Students will name one plant and two animals that live in the desert

children.title: Here is the Southwest Desert
children.teaser: Students will state that the desert habitat is hot and dry

children.title: The Farm
children.teaser: Students will identify by name the farm habitat

children.title: The Farm (Continued)
children.teaser: Students will name one plant and two animals that live on the farm

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material
children.teaser: Students will identify the ocean habitat

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material (Continued...)
children.teaser: Students will name three animals that live in the ocean

children.title: Review, Reinforce, Extension of Material (Continued)
children.teaser: Students will state that the ocean habitat has salty water and a sandy beach

children.teaser: Students will point to the front cover, title, and back cover of a book

children.title: Important People in American History
children.teaser: This Unit contains a total of eighteen days of instruction which may be interspersed throughout the school year.

children.title: The Native Americans
children.teaser: Students will describe what our country is like today

children.title: The Pilgrims
children.teaser: Students will state why the Pilgrims left England

children.title: Martin Luther King Jr
children.teaser: Students will state why we celebrate Martin Luther King Jr.'s birthday

children.title: Barack Obama
children.teaser: Students will participate in an act of voting

children.title: Abraham Lincoln
children.teaser: Students will identify Abraham Lincoln as president of the United States

children.title: Sally Ride
children.teaser: Students will identify Sally Ride as an astronaut who flew into space

children.title: Sonia Soto Mayor
children.teaser: Students will identify Sonia Soto Mayor as a Supreme Court Justice
